project.teaser: Periodic inspection of the integrity of welds is essential for maintaining safe and efficient operation of critical assets. Methods based on ultrasound have numerous advantages – they are fast, accessible and non-disruptive – but they meet serious obstacles when used on...
project.objective: Periodic inspection of the integrity of welds is essential for maintaining safe and efficient operation of critical assets. Methods based on ultrasound have numerous advantages – they are fast, accessible and non-disruptive – but they meet serious obstacles when used on thick welds with a complex microstructure. The H2020 ADVISE project developed and demonstrated techniques to address these challenges in the nuclear energy context. For most of these, the knowledge of the internal material structure of the weld is essential. Building up foundations laid by ADVISE, iWeld aims to progress towards implementing the imaging and characterisation methods in-situ and broaden their application scope beyond the nuclear energy sector. The project will combine insights from a wide spectrum of industries to construct a comprehensive weld library which will be used to train an AI model predicting the internal material structure of the weld. These predictions will be used in further refined inversion and imaging algorithms to deliver a comprehensive inspection planning workflow. The ambition of iWeld is to transform the way to perform ultrasonic inspection on complex welds across several branches of industry and to deliver open tools to support their development.
project.title: intelligent Weld inspection

article.title: AI-supported ultrasonic weld inspection will overcome the obstacle of thick weld joints

result.title: External project communication plan
result.description: The project communication plan also covers the project's public website.

result.title: Simplified Weld Model
result.description: D2.1 delivers a simplified weld model, in order to overcome the limitation that full microstructure simulations are too costly to generate the number of datasets necessary to train an AI model. The deliverable describes a simplified procedure mapping a calculation of the vicinity of the thermal source to larger areas, according to defined welding conditions.

result.title: Data management plan
result.description: D5.3 is the Data management plan (DMP) which covers both re-use of existing data and creation of new data, following the FAIR data management policy (Findable, Accessible, interoperable data with increased re-use by third parties). The document will be updated in the course of the project.

result.title: Weld database
result.description: D1.1 delivers a database of industrially relevant weld shapes (V, X, K, J, etc.), welding techniques (TIG, SMAW) and positions (0, 90, etc.), including tolerances and typical uncertainties.

result.title: Periodic Reporting for period 1 - iWeld (intelligent Weld inspection)
result.teaser: The operational safety of nuclear power plants (NPPs) relies on maintaining the integrity of critical parts, especially those holding high pressure and operating at high temperatures. To withhold these conditions, the parts mentioned require joining with thick welds. During...

result.title: TRL Workshop
result.description: D5.1 provides a detailed assessment of the TRL level of the object of each task at the start of the project, as well as the targeted TRL level at the end of the project. The report summarizes the outcome of a TRL workshop to be held during the kick-off meeting.
